intro: Acetosella muscoides, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a small, low-growing plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its rosette of hairy, oval-shaped leaves that resemble mouse ears, hence its common name. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Acetosella muscoides is often found in temperate regions and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to pollinators.
